comments.body:
Ah, I meant the bugs I wrote in the PR body:

> - `Service.Restriction` was incorrectly named `Service`.
> - Enum fields had wrong types.

Should I write comments more precisely?
I found your test code does not contain `CommonEventObject`, but your test is good enough ðŸ‘
@mtgto thanks! Frankly, I forgot to add a test specifically for it - will add during the weekend

> I found your test code does not contain `CommonEventObject`, but your test is good enough ðŸ‘

@mtgto - done, the `CommonEventObject` should now be covered by a test as well. Also noticed that I did not make the `formInputs[string][""]` optional because only one of the object structures is present at a time - addressed (I wanted to add a generic `OneOf` helper, but wasn't sure if that's ok given that Apps Script declaration files do not use helpers - please, let me know if you think it is a good or bad idea to add one).

@mtgto thank you! 

Re: helper - as far as I know, the above does not compile because one can only access the properties common to all members of the union, so the only way to use such a union is via narrowing with `"stringInputs" in bar`. Such a helper could look [like this](https://tsplay.dev/mbkD4W) avoiding the problem. But, anyway, that's just a passing thought, I too think the onus is more on the definition users.

Re: one of - you probably will not find anything concrete. I am interpreting this line in docs as proof of the "union field" behavior (+coming from experience - the real-world event objects confirm the supposition):

> The structure of the map value object is dependent on the widget type

I think it is a bit of a documentation shortcoming that it is not very clear (and I even forgot about that initially) :(
@mtgto I only linked to the playground to illustrate what implementation I had in mind that avoided the "no fields in common" trap ðŸ˜‡ Ok, so it seems the only thing left to do is to add the folder.
